conclusion: We have a square coil with n turns and side length a. The coil is perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field. Only half of the coil is in the magnetic field. The magnetic field increases uniformly from B to 2B over time Δt. We need to find the induced electromotive force.
The figure shows a square coil with side length a, half of which is in a magnetic field of intensity B.

premise: Area of half the coil = a²/2
conclusion: Initial magnetic flux Φ₁ = B × (a²/2) × n = (B·a²·n)/2

premise: When the magnetic field increases to 2B
conclusion: Final magnetic flux Φ₂ = 2B × (a²/2) × n = (2B·a²·n)/2 = B·a²·n

premise: The induced electromotive force (emf) is given by ε = -ΔΦ/Δt
The magnitude of the induced emf is |ε| = (B·a²·n)/(2·Δt)
The electromotive force induced in the coil is ε = -(B·a²·n)/(2·Δt)
conclusion: The electromotive force induced in the coil is ε = -(B·a²·n)/(2·Δt) and its magnitude is |ε| = (B·a²·n)/(2·Δt)
